ValueDomain.preferredName: Death Details Subcategory Clinical Study Sponsor Defined Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to death diagnosis._A subdivision that has common differentiating characteristics within a larger category._An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]_Clearly characterized or delimited._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to death diagnosis.
A subdivision that has common differentiating characteristics within a larger category.

An entity such as an individual, company, institution, group, or organization which takes responsibility for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a clinical study. The sponsor does not actually conduct the investigation unless the sponsor is a sponsor-investigator. A person other than an individual (e.g., corporation or agency) that uses one or more of its own employees to conduct research it has initiated is considered to be a sponsor, and the employees are considered to be investigators. [21 CFR P.50.3(k)] [21 CFR P.50.102(j)] [21 CFR P.312.3]
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What is the subcategory of th
ReferenceDocuments.description: What is the subcategory of the death detail assessment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header DDSCAT can only be used if there is an DDCAT and it must be a subcategorization of DDCAT.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DDSCAT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the death detail subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
